entry.string: Administration - Articles
What is it?
Articles is a Xaraya Content Module responsible for the handling of generic and complex content structures.
entry.translation: 文章是負責處理一般及複雜內容結構的 Xaraya 內容模組。

entry.string: How to use it?

If this is your first visit to this part of your Xaraya site, please take a minute to read through the following introduction, in order to explore the different possibilities offered by the articles module.
entry.translation: 如果這是你第一次到 Xaraya 站台的這個部份，請花點時間讀完以下介紹來深入文章模組的箇是可能性。

entry.string: 1. Publication types
The articles module can manage 'articles' of different types at the same time, for instance news articles, longer documents in different sections, frequently asked questions, and so on.
entry.translation: 文章模組可以同時管理不同類型的'文章'，例如新聞文章、長文件於不同區節、常見問題等等。

entry.string: These types are called 'publication types', and each type of article can make use of a different set of data fields, with a different meaning for each data field. For example, the 'summary' field could be used for an Introduction in news articles, for providing some details about a question in FAQs, or not be used at all for section documents.
entry.translation: 這些類型稱為'發布類型'，每個類型的文章使用不同組資料欄位，每個欄位有不同意義。例如，'摘要'欄位可以用為新聞文章的介紹、提供一些問題的細節於常見問題、或不被使用於區節文章。

entry.string: There is a specific menu where you can manage those publication types, change the description that will appear in navigation menus, enable and disable data fields or change their meaning for a particular type, or even create or delete publication types according to your needs.
Each publication type also has its own templates, so that you can customize the look & feel of how each article will appear to your visitors.
entry.translation: 每個發佈類型有自己的模板，所以你可以自訂每篇文章顯示給參訪者的外觀及感覺。

entry.string: A default set of publication types and templates (corresponding to the old News, Sections and FAQs modules, if you're familiar with earlier versions of PostNuke or PHP-Nuke) is included as part of the installation.
entry.translation: 一組預設的發布類型及模版(對應舊新聞，區節及常見問題模組，如果你熟悉之前版本的 PostNuke 或 PHP-Nuke) 包含在安裝裡。

entry.string: 2. Categories

Articles (of any type) can be organised into categories. You could use one or more common categories across different publication types, or use specific categories for each type of article, or any combination that you might prefer for your site.
entry.translation: 文章(每種類型)可以組織為不同類別。你可以使用一個或更多一般類別遍及不同發佈類型，或每個類型的文章有特定類別、或各種你想要的組合。

entry.string: Before you start specifying which article types will be using what categories, you should create the categorization you want via the Categories administration menu. A default set of categories has been defined for articles when you installed this module, as an example to get you started. (You can adapt the categories later on, of course.)

Once you have a set of categories you would like to use for your articles, you can go to Articles Configuration, and specify the number of categories that can be used for each publication type, and the 'base categories' to be used.

A 'base category' is any starting point somewhere in your tree of categories, below which you will have the actual list (or subtree) of categories people can choose from when they submit or view articles. For example, you could have a 'base category' called Topics, with a list of different topics relevant to your site below it, and another 'base category' called Cities, with a list of cities or places that you would provide regional news for.
One topic might be 'Good Restaurants', and one city might 'Brussels', so people would be able to browse through any articles about good restaurants in Brussels, for instance.
